captions.text:
Want to spoil your girlfriend with diamonds
while impressing her with your scientific

knowledge. Here's how:
Baby, we've been together a long time

and I've picked up on your hints -- I know
that you want a diamond,

but I was thinking
you're too special to me for just one diamond.

I want to give you one and a half million
diamonds...

per second.
And not only that, they're nanodiamonds.

really?
Yeah, isn't that great? Nanodiamonds.

You are a fu-
Now is the perfect time to tell her scientists

have recently discovered nanodiamonds in the
flames of ordinary candles -- millions of

them!
As the hydrocarbon wax is burned tiny diamonds
form in the middle of the flame.

What? They're the exact same as regular diamonds,
just really, really small. You always told

me size doesn't matter. Are you packing?
I should have listened to my mother.

Actually, as it turns out, the nanodiamonds
are burnt up in the flame and released into

the atmosphere as carbon dioxide. So you're
better off getting a big diamond. Otherwise

your relationship, like the nanodiamonds,
will go up in smoke.

comments.text:
+terrdeath That guy said "probably" meaning he isn't sure, he's just made 
an assumption. It's much smarter than insulting other people. Diamond is a 
face centered cube structure of carbon atoms and can be as small as 14 
atoms, so he is totally right. Also, it's NOT A MOLECULE, it's a crystal. 
Some molecules can be much bigger than that (ADN is a molecule much much 
bigger than that). He is totally right twice by not calling it a molecule.

large. And the diamonds that you would get are only industrial grade. If 
you could fuse them with small quantities of metallic substances, then yes 
it would be worth it. You would be able to give the diamonds special colors 
like real diamonds. Industrial diamonds by comparison are not valuable and 
are much easier to make.

comments.text:
+Kaitlyn Amanda
I really don't see how homosexuals are only finally getting "rights". The 
only time that they didn't was when society was for the most part dependent 
on religion, which if you didn't even go to church you could be hanged. 
Homosexuals could vote, get jobs, own land, and much of everything for the 
past years. The only right they don't have in most places is marriage. I 
would say that rather than getting rights, homosexuals are getting 
understanding and tolerance in society.

I know this is off topic of what I am saying, however I entirely hate that 
even our school systems use the terms gay, lesbian, queer, ect. I would 
much rather youth to learn the correct terms of which to apply to the 
different types of people.

Another note, homophobes is not the correct term. Being "Scared of the 
same" is not really descriptive enough, yes it is short and memorable, 
however the term homosexualaphobe or something to that effect would be more 
reasonable. However that is my term. Some would argue that "phobe" is not 
the correct post-fix to the term, however we are naturally wired to be 
scared of the unknown and reject it. Homosexuals have different feelings 
and thinking patterns than we have, so we are naturally going to shove them 
away. Of course science and ideology has changed this, but it is just the 
way we work.

Natural diamonds aren't even as pure as synthetic, laser cut diamonds. 
 What you're paying for is 1) the monopoly price because only a tiny number 
of companies control the entire diamond trade, 2) the child labor and, 3) 
transport across a conflict zone.  Then when you try to resell your $3,000 
diamond ring you get nothing from the jeweler because diamonds are 
intrinsically worthless.
